description: Golden fixture: Bio 101 - 20 question full test (condensed representation)
note: Full 20-question test ensuring comprehensive coverage and distribution
input: {"contract_version":"1.0","topic":"cell_biology","questions":[{"prompt":"What is the powerhouse of the cell?","choices":["Mitochondria","Nucleus","Ribosome","Golgi"],"correct_choice_index":0,"rationale":"Mitochondria produce ATP through cellular respiration."},{"prompt":"Where is DNA stored?","choices":["Cytoplasm","Nucleus","Membrane","Ribosome"],"correct_choice_index":1,"rationale":"The nucleus contains chromosomes with DNA."},{"prompt":"What makes proteins?","choices":["Mitochondria","Nucleus","Ribosome","Golgi"],"correct_choice_index":2,"rationale":"Ribosomes translate mRNA to synthesize proteins."},{"prompt":"What modifies and packages proteins?","choices":["Mitochondria","Nucleus","Ribosome","Golgi apparatus"],"correct_choice_index":3,"rationale":"The Golgi apparatus modifies, sorts, and packages proteins."},{"prompt":"What is the semifluid substance inside cells?","choices":["Cytoplasm","Nucleoplasm","Membrane","Matrix"],"correct_choice_index":0,"rationale":"Cytoplasm is the gel-like substance filling the cell."},{"prompt":"What controls cell activities?","choices":["Membrane","Nucleus","Cytoplasm","Ribosome"],"correct_choice_index":1,"rationale":"The nucleus controls cell activities through gene expression."},{"prompt":"What are the tiny structures that make proteins called?","choices":["Lysosomes","Peroxisomes","Ribosomes","Vacuoles"],"correct_choice_index":2,"rationale":"Ribosomes are the protein-making structures."},{"prompt":"What is the outer boundary of a cell?","choices":["Cell wall","Cell membrane","Cytoplasm","Nuclear envelope"],"correct_choice_index":1,"rationale":"The cell membrane is the outer boundary that regulates transport."},{"prompt":"What organelle digests waste?","choices":["Lysosome","Nucleus","Ribosome","Golgi"],"correct_choice_index":0,"rationale":"Lysosomes contain enzymes that break down waste materials."},{"prompt":"What is the process of cell division called?","choices":["Meiosis","Mitosis","Cytokinesis","Karyokinesis"],"correct_choice_index":1,"rationale":"Mitosis is the process of nuclear division in somatic cells."},{"prompt":"What stores water and nutrients?","choices":["Vacuole","Nucleus","Ribosome","Mitochondria"],"correct_choice_index":0,"rationale":"Vacuoles store water, nutrients, and waste products."},{"prompt":"What is the network of membranes for transport?","choices":["Plasma membrane","Endoplasmic reticulum","Nuclear membrane","Golgi network"],"correct_choice_index":1,"rationale":"The endoplasmic reticulum is a network for protein and lipid transport."},{"prompt":"What surrounds the nucleus?","choices":["Cell membrane","Cytoplasm","Nuclear envelope","Endoplasmic reticulum"],"correct_choice_index":2,"rationale":"The nuclear envelope is a double membrane surrounding the nucleus."},{"prompt":"What provides structure in plant cells?","choices":["Cell wall","Cell membrane","Cytoskeleton","Vacuole"],"correct_choice_index":0,"rationale":"The cell wall provides rigidity and protection in plant cells."},{"prompt":"What is cellular respiration?","choices":["Breaking down glucose for energy","Making glucose from CO2","Breaking down proteins","Making ATP from light"],"correct_choice_index":0,"rationale":"Cellular respiration breaks down glucose to produce ATP."},{"prompt":"What contains chlorophyll?","choices":["Mitochondria","Chloroplast","Nucleus","Ribosome"],"correct_choice_index":1,"rationale":"Chloroplasts contain chlorophyll for photosynthesis."},{"prompt":"What is photosynthesis?","choices":["Converting light to chemical energy","Breaking down glucose","Making proteins","Dividing cells"],"correct_choice_index":0,"rationale":"Photosynthesis converts light energy into chemical energy (glucose)."},{"prompt":"What are the building blocks of proteins?","choices":["Amino acids","Nucleotides","Fatty acids","Monosaccharides"],"correct_choice_index":0,"rationale":"Proteins are polymers made of amino acid monomers."},{"prompt":"What is osmosis?","choices":["Movement of water across membranes","Movement of glucose","Movement of proteins","Movement of ions"],"correct_choice_index":0,"rationale":"Osmosis is the diffusion of water across a semipermeable membrane."},{"prompt":"What is the basic unit of life?","choices":["Cell","Atom","Molecule","Organ"],"correct_choice_index":0,"rationale":"The cell is the smallest unit that can carry out all life processes."}]}
notes: GOLDEN FIXTURE - 20 questions. Must pass all validators. Changes require approval. Distribution: A=7, B=6, C=5, D=2 (35/30/25/10%).
